fields.description:
This bug report relates to warnings logged by the [Database Constraint Checker|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/The+Database+Constraint+Checker] which was introduced in Confluence 5.7. 

h3. Cause
This particular warning occurs because there is a column included in an index that Confluence was not expecting.

This warning has been encountered on these columns:
{code}
- spacepermissions.sp_comp_idx
- spacepermissions.sp_creator_idx
- spacepermissions.sp_lastmodifier_idx
- cwd_app_dir_group_mapping.idx_app_dir_group_mapping
- cwd_app_dir_group_mapping.idx_app_dir_group_group_dir
- cwd_app_dir_group_mapping.idx_app_dir_group_app
- content_perm_set.cps_permtype_idx
- bandana.band_cont_key_idx
- cwd_application.idx_app_active
- cwd_application.idx_app_type
- cwd_user_credential_record.idx_user_cred_record_user_id
- contentproperties.content_prop_str_idx
- contentproperties.content_prop_long_idx
- contentproperties.content_prop_name_idx
- contentproperties.content_prop_date_idx
- trackbacklinks.tbl_lastmodifier_idx
- trackbacklinks.tbl_creator_idx
- cwd_membership.idx_mem_dir_child
- cwd_membership.idx_mem_dir_parent
- cwd_membership.idx_mem_dir_child_user
- cwd_membership.idx_mem_dir_parent_child
- content_perm.cp_creator_idx
- content_perm.cp_lastmodifier_idx
- content_label.cl_owner_idx
{code}
These warnings appear in the logs:
{code}
2014-12-14 19:07:49,320 WARN [main] [core.persistence.schema.StartupSchemaChecker] handleWarnings Index [sp_comp_idx] of table [spacepermissions] has mismatched definitions for expected [Index spacepermissions.sp_comp_idx on [permtype, permgroupname] non-unique] and actual [Index spacepermissions.sp_comp_idx on [permtype, permgroupname, permusername] non-unique]
{code}

h3.Impact
A composite index is an index created on multiple columns. When all the columns in an index are specified in a query (and in the same order as the index), there is no impact. However, if a query makes use of only a few of the columns, the index will be ignored, and a sequential search will be performed. In large databases, this can be a performance hit.

In some cases, indexes are created on combinations of columns that do see realistic use. For example, space permissions are queried by group name, or by username - but never by both at the same time. Thus an index on both the {{permgroupname}} and {{permusername}} columns would not provide any improvement, and could actually cause a decrease in performance in certain scenarios.

h3. Resolution
To resolve these warnings, you will need to change the schema of your database to specify that each column should be nullable. The way you would achieve this varies across each database system, so refer to the official documentation for your database.

To resolve these warnings, you should drop the mentioned index, and re-create it. The syntax will depend on your particular database variety, but generally the following should work:

h4.Postgres, Oracle, MSSQL:
{code}
DROP INDEX <index_name>;
{code}

h4.MySQL:
{code}
ALTER TABLE <table_name> DROP INDEX <index_name>;
{code}

Next, allow Confluence to recreate the index. Add {{-Datlassian.forceSchemaUpdate=true}} to your [JVM Arguments|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+System+Properties] and restart Confluence. On the next restart, Confluence will recreate any indexes that are missing.

Confluence will note that the index has been dropped, with a similar warning message:

{code}
2015-03-23 10:54:21,559 WARN [localhost-startStop-1] [core.persistence.schema.StartupSchemaChecker] handleWarnings Database schema is inconsistent with expectations - %s warnings, see below
2015-03-23 10:54:21,560 WARN [localhost-startStop-1] [core.persistence.schema.StartupSchemaChecker] handleWarnings Index [sp_comp_idx] of table [spacepermissions] is missing; expected [Index spacepermissions.sp_comp_idx on [permtype, permgroupname] non-unique]
{code}

If the flag is enabled, Confluence will generate a recovery file, and then repair the schema. You can use your database tools to verify that the specified index has been re-created.

Please feel free to [contact Support|https://support.atlassian.com] for help with this.
fields.summary: Database Constraint Checker has mismatched definitions for expected index definitions

fields.description:
This bug report relates to warnings logged by the [Database Constraint Checker|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/The+Database+Constraint+Checker] which was introduced in Confluence 5.7. 

h3. Cause
This particular warning occurs because there is a column in the database which should allow null values, but does not.

This warning has been encountered on these columns:

* follow_connections.follower
* follow_connections.followee

These warnings appear in the logs:
{code}
Column [follower] of table [follow_connections] has mismatched definitions for expected [Column follow_connections.follower varchar(255) nullable] and actual [Column follow_connections.follower varchar(255) non-nullable]

Column [followee] of table [follow_connections] has mismatched definitions for expected [Column follow_connections.followee varchar(255) nullable] and actual [Column follow_connections.followee varchar(255) non-nullable]
{code}

h3. Impact
With a {{non-nullable}} column, null values are not permitted. Under normal circumstances, Confluence should not insert null values into these tables.

However, if Confluence were to insert a null value into one of these tables (and the column is {{non-nullable}}), the insert statement would fail. Inserting a null value would have no operational impact on Confluence.

h3. Resolution
In many cases these warnings can be ignored. Often, Confluence's code will also be null-safe, which means that it may never attempt to enter a null into these columns. However, there is always a risk of data becoming inconsistent through bugs or manual changes, and these constraints help to guard against that.

To resolve these warnings, you will need to change the columns of the target table (in our case, follow_connections) and specify that each column displayed in the warnings (follower and followee in our case) to be nullable. The way you would achieve this varies across each database system, so refer to the official documentation for your database.

Please feel free to [contact Support|https://support.atlassian.com] for help with this.
fields.summary: Database Constraint Checker has mismatched definitions for expected nullable and actual non-nullable

fields.description:
It took me a fair amount of time during the installation to realize that the upgrade option for Confluence is option #3, not option #2, based on these instructions:

Please choose one of the following:
Express Install (uses default settings) [1], Custom Install (recommended for advanced users) [2], Upgrade an existing Confluence installation [3, Enter]

The usual convention is to put the option number before the text label, not after it.  It eventually took a Google search for me to find someone else who had made the same mistake, then discovered the misreading.

I would like to request the options be reformatted to something similar to this:

Please choose one of the following:
[1] Express Install (uses default settings)
[2] Custom Install (recommended for advanced users)
[3] (default) Upgrade an existing Confluence installation
(Enter=3)
fields.summary: Clarify the options during the installation/upgrade proces

fields.description:
*Steps to Replicate*
# Download and Install Confluence 5.7
# Access Confluence via Internet explorer
# Create a page > Click Insert > Files and Images
# Add a image in the page
# Save the page
# Drag the image to another place in the same page


h6. Observed Behavior
The image is added as an attachment to the page again

h6. Expected Behavior
The image should just change the place

*Workaround*
Use Moziila firefox

fields.description:
This bug report relates to warnings logged by the [Database Constraint Checker|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/The+Database+Constraint+Checker] which was introduced in Confluence 5.7. 

h3. Cause
This particular warning occurs because there is a column in the database which should not allow null values, but does.

This warning has been encountered on these columns:
* content_label.labelid
* logininfo.username
* confversion.buildnumber
* content_perm.cp_type
* trustedapp.public_key_id

These warnings appear in the logs:
{code}
Column [labelid] of table [content_label] has mismatched definitions for expected [Column content_label.labelid int8 non-nullable] and actual [Column content_label.labelid int8(19) nullable]

Column [username] of table [logininfo] has mismatched definitions for expected [Column logininfo.username varchar(255) non-nullable] and actual [Column logininfo.username varchar(255) nullable]

Column [buildnumber] of table [confversion] has mismatched definitions for expected [Column confversion.buildnumber int4 non-nullable] and actual [Column confversion.buildnumber int4(10) nullable]

Column [cp_type] of table [content_perm] has mismatched definitions for expected [Column content_perm.cp_type varchar(10) non-nullable] and actual [Column content_perm.cp_type varchar(10) nullable]

Column [public_key_id] of table [trustedapp] has mismatched definitions for expected [Column trustedapp.public_key_id int8 non-nullable] and actual [Column trustedapp.public_key_id int8(19) nullable]
{code}

h3. Impact
When Confluence retrieves information from these columns, it expects a real value. If your database allows null values in these columns, you could end up with inconsistent data in the database that can cause other problems later on, eg during upgrades, or during general use. Usually these will manifest in the form of NullPointerExceptions. 

h3. Resolution
In many cases these warnings can be ignored. Often, Confluence's code will also be null-safe, which means that it may never attempt to enter a null into these columns. However, there is always a risk of data becoming inconsistent through bugs or manual changes, and these constraints help to guard against that.

To resolve these warnings, you will need to change the schema of your database to specify that each column should be non-nullable. The way you would achieve this varies across each database system, so refer to the official documentation for your database.

NB: If there are any nulls in this column already, those rows will need to be removed/cleaned before you can achieve this. Please feel free to [contact Support|https://support.atlassian.com] for help with this.
fields.summary: Database Constraint Checker has mismatched definitions for expected non-nullable and actual nullable

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page with lots of content (~100 lines)
# Add some Inline tasks to it
# Save it
# Mark one of the tasks complete
# Observe that you receive a notification containing the entire page

This can cause outages (OutOfMemory or GC Overhead) if the page is large and there are multiple tasks and multiple watchers.
fields.summary: 'Task marked complete' notification email includes the entire page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36943].
  {panel}

I have previously used com.atlassian.confluence.util.ExcerptHelper class in Confluence to create page exceprts based on "excerpt" macro.

For some time now this stopped being possible via IoC injection. 

There are still [Answers|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/109112/get-value-from-excerpt-macro-in-a-page-confluence-4.3] and [developer-to-developer discussions|https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/hipchat-for-confluence/pull-request/5/add-tl-dr-from-new-blog-posts-to-hipchat/diff] around for older code base that it should be possible to use the class, but it seems to not be possible to have this class injected anymore.

Atlassian's own code seems to be able to [have it injected|https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/confluence-advanced-macros-plugin/src/0ba9e7b4f4815cc91d705b8a8a086542bddd9f56/src/main/java/com/atlassian/confluence/plugins/macros/advanced/xhtml/ExcerptIncludeMacro.java?at=master#cl-154], but not plugins.

During upgrade of one of our plugins to support 5.7 I was forced to replicate the code of ExcerptHelper in our own project, with changes since not all classes that relies on are available to plugins either. 

I do see in another [Answer|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/240777] a piece of "normal" IoC setter code commented out in favor of lazy initialization via direct call to ContainerManager.getComponent("excerptHelper"). Not sure if it works in 5.7 as the date on the post is 2013.

Does it have to be this hard? Can ExcerptHelper be marked as available for plugins in rederingContext.xml or something similar to [CONF-22371|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-22371] magic be done?

I also note that often when a consumer of API like us wants an excerpt from a page developers will have to repeat the same pattern - use ExcerptHelper to extract "excerpt" macro content and if there is none, use something like com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.view.excerpt.Excerpter (perfectly injectable) to fall back to another method - so perhaps it would be nice to supply an injectable helper class with aggregated functionality?
fields.summary: Make ExcerptHelper injectable into add-ons code (again?)

Inline comments need some improvements.  Currently, there is no way to tell if a page has any inline comments just by looking at the top of the page.  A user has to visually scan the page and try to see if there is any highlighting indicating an inline comment.  This is hard to do and undesirable for several reasons:

# The page may be dense or very busy,
# the highlighting used is faint and hard to see on many monitors we tested,
# the can take a long time to do on long pages without any guarantee of success and the effort may be wasted if there are no comments.

Also, there is no way to open the inline comment browser except for finding an inline comment and clicking on it.  We request the following features:

# Display a count of the inline comments at the top of the page.
# Provide a link / menu option / keyboard shortcut to view the inline comments when you are not currently viewing any inline comments.
## If the count of inline comments is > 0, then the count could be a link that, when clicked, opens the right-side sidebar to view and navigate inline comments for the page.
## Hitting ] should toggle the right-side inline comment navigator.
fields.summary: Improve Inline Comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36930].
  {panel}

[Release notes for Confluence 5.7|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+5.7+Release+Notes#Confluence5.7ReleaseNotes-Smallimprovementswithabigimpact] say that "The editor 'Cancel' button will now say 'Close' and, the best part is, it'll save a draft of your page just in case you didn't mean to close the editor." 

However it appears that clicking Close does not save a new draft, it merely retains the last autosaved draft. So you can still lose changes that were made after the last autosave. 

It would be great if clicking Close triggered an autosave, so that nothing is lost. 

Workaround: Wait for an autosave after your last change, or click Preview before Close (Preview forces an autosave, however note [CONF-36410|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-36410]). Of course this isn't very helpful because it relies on the user anticipating problems and intentionally closing without saving, rather than doing it accidentally, which may be the more common case. 

To reproduce:
* edit a page and make a change
* click Close before the change is autosaved
* go to Drafts and see that the change is not there
* edit the page again and make a change
* sit on the page until an autosave occurs, then click Close
* go to Drafts and see that the change is there
fields.summary: Save a new draft on Close

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce :
# Login to Confluence
# Create a page with the Restrospective template
# On the pre-existing text or instructional text, type @ and mention a name

Current behavior : The text after the "@" skip to the end of the instructional text
Expected behavior : The text after the "@" should not skip to the end of the instructional text but instead erase all instructional text and replaces with the text that is being input.

Here is the video of the behavior [^mentionTemplateTest.mp4].

Reproduceable on the latest version of Firefox (36.0.1)
fields.summary: mentions not working properly on Firefox for existing Confluence template with instructional text

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36920].
  {panel}

1. Create a page with text "there the there the there".
2. Highlight the first occurrence of " the " (with spaces included)
3. Try to create Inline Comment

The insert should fail. The reason is that the data sent from the client to the server (check the AJAX request) will list " the " as the first match, but will trim the originalSelection text to be only "the". Technically, the first occurrence of "the" is in the first "there" and the matching algorithm gets confused and fails.
fields.summary: Can't find an occurrence of text when creating inline comment

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36914].
  {panel}

My requirement is , when a person creates a space, confluence should automatically check the user group where he belongs and automatically open the space only to that group.Is it possible?

Here's an example of a scenario that explain this feature:
# There is a user (USERA) with the following group membership
#* Creative
#* Technical
#* Awesome
#* Smart
# The USERA is constantly require to create spaces that are view-able by this four group only due to his job scope.
# There is another user (USERB) with the following group membership
#* High
#* Low
#* North
#* South
# Similarly, USERB is constantly require to create spaces that are view-able by this four group which he has membership in.

For now, the only option for them is to assign those group into the space permission after the space is created. This can be a tedious task and time consuming. 

It would be convenient if there is an option that allow the user to assign their group into the space permission during the creation of the spaces.
fields.summary: Ability to automatically add the group into the space  permission based on the membership of the user who created the space.
Allow clicking on code block title to expand code block

fields.description:
To reproduce:
* go to a page that has many descendants (10000 including attachments and comments should be enough)
* add a view restriction (e.g. limit viewing to yourself)
* check the index queue - it should be so large that it will take several minutes to process
* go to a page that has many descendants
* add/remove a view restriction

What should happen:
* the restriction is set and is inherited by all descendants. The index is updated to reflect that fact

What happens instead:
* An exception is thrown on the server (see below) and passed to the AJAX request
* No error handler is defined for the AJAX request, so no error message is shown to the user - the user gets no feedback at all
* At least one insert into the journal queue fails (see exception below) - i.e. the index will not reflect the permission change above

I am aware of the fact that setting {{innodb_lock_wait_timeout}} in MySql to a higher value can work around this problem (it is set to 50 right now - I have not found any official recommendations from Atlassian for this), but this would just move the problem, not fix it.

fields.description:
*Bug Description*

Confluence does resize profile picture of user before restoring it when it was uploaded through remote API (addProfilePicture) method. Confluence will still render the picture as resized in profile picture and profile macro. However, when e-mail notification send out it will be in the original size.

*How to replicate*

# Upload a large picture as profile picture through user interface
# Render the profile picture using {{profile picture}} macro
# Confluence will show it as resize
# Upload a large profile picture through API (addProfilePicture)
# Access the profile picture using {{profile picture}} macro
# Confluence will show it as original size in preview mode
# Save the page, {{profile picture}} will automatically convert it
# Send mail notification using the page, Confluence will send over the original size
fields.summary: Confluence does not resize profile picture uploaded through API

  {panel}

For the Profile picture and also the attachments page, there's no message on the limit to be upload. Sometimes, when the users do not know about the limit, they upload the file and will receive a message like the following one:

!error.png!

This is a feature request have a Warning with the size to be uploaded in the instance. For example, for the profile picture, the attachment size would be of 1.5MB. And for the attachments itself, we could have the limit message near to the upload option, near on the following example:

!attachment.png!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36899].
  {panel}

In Confluence 5.7 and later version, we have the bundled *Confluence Previews* add-on, which is responsible for creating the preview for the attachments in the instance. 

By disabling this add-on, Confluence will not provide the option to preview any file and instead of it, for attachments like PDF, Word, Excel, it will download the file. However, for the images, no option will be provided. Neither to download it or to preview. 

This is a feature request to provide an option (or a new module in the add-on) to disable the preview only for specific attachments such as Word, PDF, Excel and the images will still be able to be previewed.

PS: We do have options to disable only the preview for PDF with the following modules:

*Confluence Previews PDF webworker resource(confluence-previews-pdf-worker)*
*Confluence Previews Resources for pdf viewer(confluence-previews-pdf)*

However, both will make the preview be displayed, but, the PDF file will keep loading and will not display the file at all, which is not the same behaviour as requested in this one.
fields.summary: Option to Disable Preview of Specific Attachments (PDF, Excel, Word)

  {panel}

As a space admin, I have the rights to remove the VIEW-restriction of specific users of restricted pages.
When I remove restrictions from a page (Space Tools -> Restricted Pages -> Click the lock symbol), I get following message:
"You do not have permission to view this page. Request access below, you will receive an email when you've been granted access."
"Your request for access has not been sent. Contact your space admin."

The removal itself works, but the message is totally misleading! There should be a message like:
'Removed restrictions $restrictions for page: $pageTitle (not) successfully'.
fields.summary: Removing a Restricted Page will not 'Removed Successfully' message

fields.description:
Some of the resources are duplicated across roadmap-javascript and view-roadmap-javascript. The following resources are duplicated:

roadmap-javascript/templates.js view-roadmap-javascript/templates.js
roadmap-javascript/roadmap-editinplace.js view-roadmap-javascript/roadmap-editinplace.js
roadmap-javascript/roadmap.css view-roadmap-javascript/roadmap.css
roadmap-javascript/dialog.js view-roadmap-javascript/dialog.js
roadmap-javascript/bar-dialog.js view-roadmap-javascript/bar-dialog.js
roadmap-javascript/bar-link-new-page.js view-roadmap-javascript/bar-link-new-page.js
roadmap-javascript/roadmap-analytics.js view-roadmap-javascript/roadmap-analytics.js 


As a general rule of thumb : every static resource file inside a plugin should appear in one and only one <web-resource>.  In this case, factor the common JS into a separate web-resource that both the roadmap-javascript and view-roadmap-javascript depend on.

It would also be good if templates.soy could be split into a series of smaller soy template files, so we can reduce the amount of soy inside the view-roadmap-javascript resource. Same with roadmap.css if possible.
fields.summary: Confluence Roadmap Plugin includes some resources multiple times

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36885].
  {panel}

I really love the global "g then x" pattern to navigate around Confluence. I get quite a lot of use out of g+g or / to open quick search, and g+d is useful for getting to the dashboard, but after using these a bit, I found myself expecting there to be a shortcut for navigating directly to the homepage of a targeted space.

In other words, I envision:
* g then (p) - opens a space picker dialog
* type the first few characters of the desired space to filter the list
* hit enter once the desired space is highlighted; browser navigates to that space

At present, you can sort of do this with the quick search, but you will have to type more characters to filter the list properly, and will still have to hit the down arrow a couple of times to pass over the list of pages down to the space results. A dedicated shortcut and picker would be much better for this.

I'm not sure what key should be used for this -- my expectation was that g+s would fit the best, and "browse current" would be set to g+c or something. But that's not the important part!
fields.summary: Keyboard shortcut: Go to space

fields.description:
h3. Scenario * JIRA (e.g. 6.1.8) is linked to Confluence (e.g. 5.4.4) * Let's say you have a JIRA issue with many comments which contains SOAP requests and respones inside code macro. * As a side note, a word export of the JIRA issue generates a 13MB document * A response has 60000 lines of code * Count from ao_9412a1_aonotification {code}mysql> select COUNT(*) FROM ao_9412a1_aonotification; +----------+ | COUNT(*) | +----------+ | 1233 | +----------+ 1 row in set (0.01 sec){code} * JIRA Application log entries {code}2015-03-03 05:07:58,061 com.atlassian.mywork.client.reliability.DefaultUnreliableWorker:thread-119 WARN ... 474x28253x1 hfscwy ... /rest/api/2/issue/SUPPORT-22311/comment [mywork.client.reliability.DefaultReliabilityService] Failed task "{"username":"...","type":"POST","json":"{\"id\":0,\"applicationLinkId\":\"4fe19f4f-823a-390a-85c9-e560b1fb58a0\",\"iconUrl\":\"/secure/useravatar?ownerId=u257841\",\"title\":\"..., ... commented on an issue.\",\"description\":\"

Calendar +/- 3 days (AdvancedCalendarRQ)

\\n\\n

Request:

\\n
\\n
\\r\\n<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv=\\\"http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/\\\" xmlns:sec=\\\"http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2002/12/secext\\\" xmlns:mes=\\\"http://www.ebxml.org/namespaces/messageHeader\\\" xmlns:ns=\\\"http://www.opentravel.org/OTA/2003/05\\\">\\r\\n   <soapenv:Header>\\r\\n      {code}

h3. What happens
* When you watch the issue (e.g. auto watch), you will see a notification from JIRA in the Confluence Workbox
* It will load a few seconds but it will load
* Let's say trough some JIRA events in this issue you will get 117 Workbox notification include the comment with the SOAP response
* The table size becomes 1,1GB, a SELECT load a while
* The data length of the description per row becomes round about 10MB
* When you start Confluence there seems be a database query or scheduled job with state _copy to tmp table_ (from MySQL process list).
{code:title=Info from MySQL process list}ALTER TABLE AO_9412A1_AONOTIFICATION CHANGE COLUMN METADATA METADATA LONGTEXT DEFAULT NULL{code}
* This jobs runs _forever_ and you can't access Confluence in this time because it opens many tomcat threads
{code:title=catalina.out}Mrz 13, 2015 11:58:24 AM org.apache.tomcat.util.net.JIoEndpoint createWorkerThread
Information: Maximum number of threads (150) created for connector with address null and port 8443
{code}
* To get Confluence up and running i killed the mysql job and disabled the Workbox Plugin temporary
* On a test instance i removed those 117 entries and my table becomes a normals size of 11MB

h3. Expected behaviour
* When an entry from JIRA becomes to big, cut of most of the text so that the description never becomes to big again in the database.
fields.summary: Maximum length of Workbox notification text

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36870].
  {panel}

The default timeout (which was wrongly set to 12 seconds) will be reset to 0 (which means no timeout) so that the configured timeout will be effective.
We need to update the front end code in 2 plugins:
* confluence-jira-content, which is responsible for creating a JIRA issue from a highlighted text
* jira-integration-plugin, a cross-product plugin which can be used in any Atlassian products for creating a JIRA issue. Currently, it is being used by JIRA Issues Macro (JIM).
Check if:
* The timeout won't happen in any browsers.
* JIRA projects can't be loaded when JIRA is down.
* JIRA Issue can't be created when JIRA is down
fields.summary: Override the default timeout of Ajax requests

fields.description:
There are several handlers that are receiving the postPaste event and some times the handler you don't expect will process the post.

There should only be one postPaste handler and we should manage the handlers ourselves to make sure their order and result is deterministic.

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
# create a new page based off of a blueprint (how-to-article, task list)
# After creating, search for 'blueprint'

h3. Expected result
Only pages/spaces with content of 'blueprint' will appear in the search

h3. Actual result
Any page created from a blueprint will show in the search with *blueprint-index-page*
Please see the attachment

h3. Use Case
{quote}
We're documenting a manufacturing test development enviornment with Confluence. One of the constructs in our environment is named "Blueprint". When we search for "Blueprint", we get a listing of all of the confluence blueprint index pages - none of which have any relevance to the Blueprint in our taxonomy. Is there a way to prevent this? {quote}

h3. Workaround
Search for *blueprint NOT "blueprint-index-page"*
fields.summary: Creating a page from a blueprint indexes in the search as 'blueprint'
Live collaboration editing

fields.description:
h2. Steps to reproduce
 # Create a new page
 # Add a table with a couple of cells (though the issue can be reproduced with just 1 cell as well)
 # In each cell, add a large amount of text (e.g. several paragraphs of content)
 # Save page
 # Tools > Export to Word

h2. Expected result

The resulting Word doc will contain all the text and viewable by the user
h2. Actual result

When viewing the resulting Word doc, any large body of text within a table cell that exceeds the size of one Word page will be truncated and not viewable
h2. Other info

If the Word document is exploded and the underlying XML file examined, the full body of the text is actually all there, just not viewable through Word.

Example of the exported page using Confluence 7.7.4

!Screen Shot 2020-11-17 at 11.30.33 AM.png|width=448,height=156!
h3. Workaround

Export to PDF and then convert the PDF file to Word will work for getting the file converted to Word. This requires the use of a third-party tool to convert PDF to Word.
fields.summary: "Export to Word" documents will truncated text if too much content are inside table cells

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36863].
  {panel}

Currently the date picker  macro uses the dd-mm-yyyy:
!date.png|thumbnail!

If you configure confluence to use a different time format, like mm-dd-yyyy, the macro will still uses the dd-mm-yyyy.

I know that if we manually select the date you want the macro will works fine, however if you are used to type you will write the date you want instead of selecting you will end up writing a wrong date since you are used to a different format.

It would be nice if the macro could use the same format as used by Confluence so customers that are used to write and uses a different date format will not need to worry about that detail.
fields.summary: Make the date time macro use the confluence date format

fields.description:
*Editor Cursor* is missing in the first section when the *Documentation Theme* is applied on Firefox 34, 35, 36.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open up your Firefox browser.
# Go to a Confluence Space.
# Apply *Documentation Theme* via *Space Tools* > *Look and Feel* > *Themes*.
# Select *Documentation Theme* and click *Confirm*.
# Create a blank page in the space.
# Add a section using the *Page Layout* button.
!section.png|thumbnail!
# Type some texts in the first section.
# Add another section using the "*+ Add Section*" button.
# Type some texts in the second section.
# *Save* the page.
# *Edit* the page.
# Observe the result.

h3. Expected Behaviour
Editor cursor should appear in the first section.

h3. Actual Behaviour
Editor cursor is missing in the first section no matter how many times you click it.

h3. Note
For more information, please refer to the following screencast.
!Firefox_Cursor.mp4!

(i) This could be a regression of this bug report: [CONF-33922|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-33922]
fields.summary: Editor Cursor Does Not Appear in Firefox using Documentation Theme

Actual behavior: The test user can delete the comment

Set an existing space/page as template

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Create a project with a project key of "DO" in JIRA
# Create a JIRA Report page (status report) in Confluence that queries this project
# Save the page

h3. Result:
All reports fail, the charts report "JIRA Issues Macro: com.atlassian.sal.api.net.ResponseException: Can not retrieve jira chart image"

h3. Cause:
"DO" is a reserved word in JQL. This issue would not be a problem if the reports were created with the project key quoted in the JOL.

h3. Workaround:
Manually edit each report on the page after creation, quoting the project key in the JQL queries.
fields.summary: JIRA Report blueprint creates invalid JQL if project key is a reserved word

fields.description:
h3. Summary When upgrading Confluence 5.4.X to 5.7.x, if there are pages that have an include-page macro that points to a blog post it will display an 'Unable to render The included page could not be found' error instead of the included page h3. Reproduction steps: # Install Confluence 5.4.4 # Create a blog post # Create a blank page, add an include-page macro that points to the previously created blog post # Save the page and see that it renders correctly # Stop Confluence # Upgrade to Confluence 5.7.1 # Go back to the page created in step 3 h3. Expected behavior The blog post is rendered in the page h3. Actual behavior 'Unable to render The included page could not be found' is displayed instead of the blog post's contents h3. Related Notes * If you look at the storage format you can tell the difference in how blog posts are linked: ** Confluence 5.4.4 *** {code}

{code} ** Confluence 5.7.1 *** {code}

{code} * It looks like there should be an upgrade job that finds existing include-page macros and convert them to the new format, and it either doesn't exist or is not working. h3. Workaround # Edit the include macro and add a / before the start of the date. # Save and view the page
fields.summary: 'Unable to render include The included page could not be found.' message displayed for include-page macros after upgrading Confluence
